section: Company will use its best efforts to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. However, Company guarantees completion within 8 weeks, with penalties for delays beyond this timeframe as specified elsewhere in this Agreement.
explanation: The text states the project timeframe is 12 weeks, from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018, but then contradicts itself by guaranteeing completion within 8 weeks. This creates an in-text contradiction, as the initial timeframe and the guaranteed timeframe are different, leading to confusion about the actual completion date.

section: Company will use its best efforts to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. However, Company guarantees completion within 8 weeks, with penalties for delays beyond this timeframe as specified elsewhere in this Agreement.
explanation: The phrase 'penalties for delays beyond this timeframe as specified elsewhere in this Agreement' is an omission because there are no penalties specified in the agreement, creating an in-text contradiction because the timeframe is not clearly defined. If there are no penalties for delivering after 8 weeks, it is contradictory to include a 'guarantee'

section: The surcharge for rush work shall be either the standard hourly rate of $40 plus twenty-five percent (25%) or a flat fee of $100 per hour, whichever is lower.
explanation: This clause presents an ambiguity in text. '$40 plus twenty-five percent (25%)' calculates to $50. The language then states the surcharge shall be '$50 or a flat fee of $100 per hour, whichever is lower.' Logically, the rate will always be the $50 rate, but the language makes it confusing and should just clearly state the hourly rate is $50.
